title: American_Top_40_1971_September_4th
description:
"Three hours once a week with American Top 40 and you know where your favorite songs are on the national music scene."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

There is an original commercial for the American Top 40 Double Dozen record album; 24 hits for only $4.99!

"Chirpy Chirpy Cheep Cheep" at number 30 by Mac & Katie Kissoon is the highest out of eight debut songs. There are so many debuit songs that Casey lists them at the end of the first hour and then again at the end of the second hour.

"Uncle Albert/Admiral Halsey" by Paul & Linda McCartney pole-vaults from number 12 last week all the way to number one this week.

The first new female group to hit number one since the summer of 1964 have a song in this countdown.

Thirteen-year-old Donny Osmond is at number 5 with "Go Away, Little Girl," and he got the idea to record the song from the eleven-year-old son of the man who first took it to number one. 

A listener asks, "In the last twelve years, what record has stayed the longest at number one?" Casey says it's a three-way tie.
